description: Imperfect Foods is a sustainabe grocery delivery service that helps you fight food waste. On average, with every order, an Imperfect customer saves 6.10 lbs of food from a lesser outcome, conserves 214.41 gallons of water, and conserves 4.78 pounds of CO2e emissions.

Why buy new electronics when you can save money and CO2 by purchasing secondhand? eBay, Best Buy and Amazon have good used electronics inventories. Decarbon's partnered specifically with Swappa, a specialist in used electronics.
Why buy new clothes when you can save money and CO2 by shopping at thrift stores? Thrift locally, or check out online thrifting at sites like thredUP.

header: Switch to a green power program
description: You can switch to clean electricity without actually putting solar panels on your home. See if your utility offers a green power program, or check out Arcadia's Renewable Energy Credit solution.

header: Install solar panels on your home
description: If you own the home you live in, going solar is another climate/wallet win-win. We recommend collecting multiple offers from providers to ensure you're getting the right system.

header: Find your local Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) box
description: Many farms offer their community regular deliveries of their latest produce. Support local food and eat more plants!
It sounds a little crazy to ride Amtrak in the United States, but you never know! Trains could be a cheaper option versus short-haul flights, too.
You do own a bike, right? Just want to make sure! If no, affordable used bikes are available on Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, Geartrade, and other sites. Check your local shop too!
Riding your bike, where safe, is the cleanest and healthiest way to get about town.
Taking public transportation is a safe and affordable way to replace driving. Use Google Maps or a similar app to see what options are available for your most common routes of travel.

header: Carpool with your friends and coworkers
description: Setting up a consistent carpool with your friends and coworkers is a great way to reduce your impact, while also making your commute more fun and interesting!
A vegan diet emits 45% less CO2e than an omnivorous diet. The more plants you eat, the better! Consider a plant-based meal service like Purple Carrot for an easy way to try it out.

header: Conduct an energy efficiency audit of your home
description: Identifying and upgrading the biggest electricity suckers in your home can help you lower your utility bills -- A climate and wallet win-win!

header: Promote bike safety in your community
description: It's fair to say that most of us want to ride our bike more, but many of us can't because of lack of proper bike safety infrastucture like protected bike lanes. We'll need to get involved in our communities to make this better.

Strikes, protests, and other forms of activism are one of the most effective ways of tackling the systemic issues tied to climate change. Join your local chapter of the Sunrise Movement and support your local environmental non-profit and mutual aid groups.

This sounds silly, and we say this very humbly, but the best thing you could do to lower your impact is to buy less stuff. It's impossible to buy nothing (we all need to eat!), and we all want to enjoy life, but we think there's value to reflecting on if your purchases are necessary or not.
You're probably not looking to buy a car right this second, but keep snoozing this tip until you are! EVs are the future, particularly when paired with clean power. A used EV is an option!
The original mode of transportation. Free, safe, healthy. Just slow.

header: Switch to a bank that doesn't finance fossil fuels
description: This isn't directly factored into your personal carbon footprint, but many major banks consumers deposit money into will use it to finance fossil fuel projects.

header: Draw your own Climate Action Venn Diagram
description: Find your climate action sweet spot! What brings you joy? What work needs doing? What are you good at? The intersection of those questions could be where you focus your efforts on climate.

A great way to divest from fossil fuels is to invest in renewable energy projects. Energea makes this easy and accessible to anyone. Sign up using Decarbon's invite link for $50 of free stock when you finish the onboarding process.
Reduc energy consumtion by purchasing Energy Star office equipment, refrigerators, dishwashers, etc.
